intro: Pseudolinosyris microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed pseudolinosyris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and the presence of distinctive stipules on its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
